com.rattat.micro.game.frog.board.elements
Class Channel

java.lang.Object
  TiledLayer
      com.rattat.micro.game.frog.board.elements.Channel

public class Channel
extends TiledLayer

A channel is a TiledLayer subclass with height of one cell. It scrolls across the screen in a loop and is used to represent one "lane" in the game - i.e one row of cars in the road or one row of logs in the river.

Author:
william@rattat.com

Method Detail

create

public static Channel create(int[] cellContents,
                             int velocity)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Create a channel instance cellContents paramater is an array containing which cells the Channel consists of. e.g. {CELL_BG_ROAD, BGROAD, CELL_CAR1, CELL_BG_ROAD} would be a four cell wide channel.

Parameters:
int[] - cellContents
int - velocity
Returns:
Channel
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

update

public void update()
Update the channel move acording to velocity then update position & cell contents to give the impression on a constantly moving image

moveByCells

public void moveByCells(int numCells)
move the channel

Parameters:
int - numCells

isColliding

public boolean isColliding(Sprite sprite)
Check if a sprite is collising with the channel

isDeadlyCollision

public boolean isDeadlyCollision(Sprite sprite)
Check if a sprite is colliding with the Channel, and if so, is the cell it is colliding with a deadly cell

Parameters:
Sprite - sprite

isLanding

public boolean isLanding(Sprite sprite)
Check is a sprite is landing on the Channel. We consider the Sprite to be landing on the Channel if its centre pixel is within the bounds of the layer.

Parameters:
Sprite - sprite

landingCell

public int landingCell(Sprite sprite)
Determine which cell (if any) a sprite is landing on isLanding() is more efficient if the specific cell is not required

Parameters:
Sprite - sprite
Returns:
int The cell the sprite is landing or -1 if none
